facts.description: Venus is the second planet from the Sun and Earth's closest planetary neighbor. It is sometimes called Earth's twin due to its similar size and structure but has a harsh environment with runaway greenhouse effects that make it the hottest planet in our solar system.

size.comparison: If Earth were the size of a nickel, Venus would be about the same size.

orbital.eccentricity: Venus has a nearly circular orbit with a very slight eccentricity.

rotation.sunrise_sunset: Sun rises in the west and sets in the east due to Venus' retrograde rotation.

temperature.description: Venus' surface temperature is hot enough to melt lead, and the atmosphere traps heat in a runaway greenhouse effect.

environment.potential_for_life: While Venus' surface is too extreme for life, conditions in the upper atmosphere may support extremophile microbes.

atmosphere.description: Venus has a thick, toxic atmosphere composed mainly of carbon dioxide with clouds of sulfuric acid.

surface.appearance: Venus' surface is covered by volcanoes and features rugged terrain shaped by tectonic forces.
surface.craters: Few impact craters, as volcanic activity resurfaces the planet frequently.

moons.description: Venus has no moons but does have a quasi-satellite called Zoozve.

magnetosphere.description: Venus has an induced magnetic field created by the interaction between the Sun's magnetic field and the planet's ionosphere.

formation.description: Venus formed around 4.6 billion years ago from the same swirling gas and dust as the other planets in the solar system.

namesake.mythology: Named after Venus, the Roman goddess of love and beauty, and the only planet named after a female deity.
